desc.p: Produces a standards-compliant Geocaching GPX file.

Unlike the services/caches/geocaches method responses, GPX files cannot contain names and descriptions in separate multiple languages. This method will attempt to choose the best language based on your preference (see langpref argument).

req.name: cache_codes
req.p: Pipe-separated list of cache codes which you are interested in. No more than 500 codes are allowed.

opt.name: langpref
opt.p: Pipe-separated list of ISO 639-1 language codes. This indicates the order of preference in which language will be chosen for GPX entities.

xml.opt: Boolean. If true then response will include http://www.groundspeak.com/cache/1/0 GPX extension. This namespace declares an extra <cache> element used by geocaching.com and many others. This namespace was initially associatied with geocaching.com, but now seems to be used in every geocaching GPX file. You probably want to have it.

opt.name: ns_gsak
opt.p: Boolean. If true then response will include http://www.gsak.net/xmlv1/5 GPX extension. This namespace declares an extra <wptExtension> element, which allows including "waypoint inheritance" information (parent-child relations). This in turn allows us to include "alternate waypoints" in the response.
We know of at least one tool that makes use of this.

xml.opt: Boolean. If true then response will include Garmin's http://www.opencaching.com/xmlschemas/opencaching/1/0 GPX extension. This namespace declares an extra <opencaching> element used by Garmin's Opencaching.com. The element includes information on cache difficulty and ratings.

opt.name: images
opt.p: Which images to include (and how to include them). One of the following values:

ul.li: none - no images will be included,
descrefs:nonspoilers - all non-spoiler images will be included as references at the end of each cache description,
descrefs:all - all images will be included (including spoilers) as references at the end of each cache description.

opt.p: Note, that cache descriptions are included only when ns_ground is set to true. In the future, more generic ways of including images in GPX files may emerge.

opt.name: latest_logs
opt.p: Boolean. If true then response will include a couple of latest log entries for this cache.
You must set ns_ground argument to true if you want to use this.

opt.name: alt_wpts
opt.p: Boolean. If true then we will include alternate waypoints in the response. These waypoints point to places associated with the cache.
You must set ns_gsak argument to true if you want to use this.
